title.narrative: C4D IR2 - SUSTAINABLE BEHAVIOUR CHANGE

description.narrative: Strategic communication planning and implementation for behaviour change, in focus counties, is provided to program sectors, for increased demand, utilisation for high impact package of services for child survival, development, protection, education and HIV interventions, which contributes to Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, families, communities adopt appropriate attitude, practice and utlize social services for Child Survival and Development (CSD), Education, Child Protection and HIV inc luding in emergency situtations with focus on vulnerable groups and the most marginalized regions of Kenya by 2013.

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF GENDER AND SOCIAL SER GARISSA

Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strategic communication planning and implementation for behaviour change, in focus counties, is provided to program sectors, forincreased demand, utilisation for high impact package of services for child survival, development, protection, education and HIVinterventions
Per cent of pregnant women in focused districts who have accurate knowledge on prevention of mother to child transmission (PMTCT).
Proportion of school going children washing their hands at 4 critical moments
Increase in proportion of children 0-5 months in UNICEF focused counties/districts exclusively breastfed.
Increase in proportion of children under five in UNICEF focussed counties/distrists who had diarrhoea in the last 14 days that were given ORS
Number of young people aged 15-24 yrs. in Nyanza, Western, Nairobi slums and Coast provinces reached with HIV prevention information through sports.

title.narrative: CLTS communication strategy and its implementation plan developed
